results.title: Journey to Antarctica
results.creator_credit: Philip Law, Frank Bagnall, Lee Robinson, Maslyn Williams and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Records a trip to Antarctica with a typical Australian National Antarctic Research Expedition. Phillip Law tells of the work done by the 70 men who man the four Australian stations. Shows the erection of an automatic weather station; reconnaisance; the daily routine of the scientists at the stations; and follows a surveying exploratory party using tractor trains and supported by aircraft.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philip Law, Frank Bagnall, Lee Robinson, Maslyn Williams and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Journey through Japan
results.creator_credit: Japan. National Tourist Organisation and Shibui Films
results.brief_description: The kinship between humans and nature is shown in this film designed to inform on all aspects of Japanese life and the countryside during the four seasons of the year. We see the modern industrial Japan and the ancient traditional ways which are still evident in ceremonies, festivals, arts and crafts, buildings and rural areas.

results.title: Journey through Britain
results.creator_credit: Frederic Goode, Terry Ashwood, Associated British-Pathe and BOAC
results.brief_description: A film tour of England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland. A panorama of countryside, villages and castles is seen side-by-side with the modern amenities which these islands also offer. The film concludes with a section of the attractions of London.

results.title: Journey of Fabio Pacchioni
results.creator_credit: Sidney Reichman, Ben Park, Unesco and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: The Italian theatre director, Fabio Pacchioni, was sent to Ecuador by UNESCO to establish a national theatre. Shows his activities, not only in recruiting and training a corps of actors, but also in projecting his own belief in the social responsibility of the theatre. The company toured remote villages and became acquainted with the people.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sidney Reichman, Ben Park, Unesco and United Nations Television

results.title: Journey of a lifetime
results.creator_credit: David Bilcock, Penn Overland Tours and Senior Films
results.brief_description: A journey by coach from England to Bombay in India, highlighting the Asian and Middle Eastern countries. Byblos, the oldest city in the world, Instanbul where East and West have mingled throughout history; the exotic Blue Mosque; Damascus so eastern in atmosphere; historic Jerusalem; the majesty of the Khyber Pass; Lahore, steeped in British colonialism; and the splendour of the Taj mahal, are a few of the fascinating places visited.

results.title: Journey north
results.creator_credit: Ted Wilson and South Australian Film, Television and Laboratories
results.brief_description: A road journey fromn Port Augusta to Alice Springs. Shows industrial development at Port Augusta; the beauty and vastness of the inland from the Flinders Ranges through Pimba and the saltbush country; wildflowers that spring up after rain; some of the station properties; opal mining at Coober Pedy; Gibber plains; the remains of bush fires; cattle droving; salt pans and dry creek beds and finally the town of Alice Springs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ted Wilson and South Australian Film, Television and Laboratories

results.title: Journey into the past: the story of the ancient civilizations of the Mediterranean
results.brief_description: Serves as a historical introduction to the early civilizations around the Mediterranean and provides a geographical background to the histories of Egypt, Greece and Rome. Shows archaeological discoveries including remains of the Roman civilization in Britain. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Journey into friendship
results.creator_credit: Wheaton Galentine, Carol Hale and World Association of Girl Guides and Girl Scouts
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how girl scouting and guiding opens the door to lasting friendships between girls of different countries focusing attention on girls from Ceylon, Denmark and Peru who are attending an annual Juliette Low gathering at ‘Our Cabana’ in Cuernavaca Mexico. Shows the girls in their homelands: in Peru making pottery, nursing, teaching native dances; in Denmark cycling and camping; in Ceylon doing social service work in a poverty stricken village. Narrated by Alan Stern. Photographed by Wheaton Galentine.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wheaton Galentine, Carol Hale and World Association of Girl Guides and Girl Scouts

results.title: Journey in France
results.creator_credit: Gunther V. Fritsch and Churchill-Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description: A picture of France seen through the eyes of the two daughters of a barge family as they travel the rivers and canals from Marseilles to Strasbourg. Presents a panorama of the history, geography, and economy of the country, and portrays the character of the French working people.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gunther V. Fritsch and Churchill-Wexler Film Productions

results.title: Journey from Zero
results.creator_credit: Roger Blais, Tim Wilson and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A journey northward from Mile Zero, where the Alaska Highway begins, through mountain wilderness. This film covers the route of the travelling library van, a free book service of the Public Library Commission of British Columbia. To oil towns, army bases, mining camps and scattered settlements, the bookmobile delivers a wide assortment of reading material.
